books.title: The Crimson Circle
books.author: Edgar Wallace
books.summary: A police inspector and an unusual private detective investigate a devious blackmail plot.

books.title: The Splendid Spur
books.author: Arthur Quiller-Couch
books.summary: Events force a young man to act for the Royalist side in the English Civil War, bringing many adventures in consequence.

books.title: Our Nig
books.author: Harriet E. Wilson
books.summary: An autobiographical account of a young biracial girl abandoned by her parents and forced into servitude in the northern United States.

books.title: The Lives and Opinions of Eminent Philosophers
books.author: Diogenes Laërtius
books.summary: Brief biographies of the prominent philosophers of ancient Greece.

books.title: The Water-Babies
books.author: Charles Kingsley
books.summary: A young, uneducated, and mistreated chimney sweep is reborn as a denizen of the fairy world, beginning a journey of moral and spiritual growth.

books.title: A Midsummer Night’s Dream
books.author: William Shakespeare
books.summary: This comedy follows four lovers and a thespian who become bewitched by fairies.

books.title: A Woman of No Importance
books.author: Oscar Wilde
books.summary: A mother’s secretive past clashes with high society when her son is offered an irresistible position with a charismatic nobleman.

books.title: The Roots of the Mountains
books.author: William Morris
books.summary: The peoples of the dales and woods must unite to defeat a foe intent on enslaving them.

books.title: McTeague
books.author: Frank Norris
books.summary: A San Francisco dentist and his wife descend into avarice, obsession, and violence.

books.title: Short Fiction
books.author: Henry Kuttner
books.summary: A collection of short fiction by Henry Kuttner, ordered by date of original publication.

books.title: A Negro Explorer at the North Pole
books.author: Matthew Henson
books.summary: The self-told story of the black man who accompanied Robert Peary during the first trip to the North Pole.

books.title: Clouds of Witness
books.author: Dorothy L. Sayers
books.summary: An aristocrat with a passion for detective work has to clear the Duke, his brother, from a charge of murder.

books.title: Walden
books.author: Henry David Thoreau
books.summary: Thoreau’s report on his social experiment of solitude, simplicity, and self-reliance.

books.title: The New State
books.author: Mary Parker Follett
books.summary: The theory of group organization is formulated and applied in an attempt to design a truly democratic political state.

books.title: Poetry
books.author: James Weldon Johnson
books.summary: A collection of poems by James Weldon Johnson.

books.title: Penguin Island
books.author: Anatole France
books.summary: A myopic saint mistakenly baptizes some penguins, ushering in a centuries-spanning satire of French history.

books.title: Invaders from the Infinite
books.author: John W. Campbell
books.summary: Three scientists join with an alien race to defeat an attacking force.

books.title: Lost Face
books.author: Jack London
books.summary: A collection of short stories by Jack London.

books.title: A Day at a Time
books.author: Archibald Alexander
books.summary: A 1916 Christian devotional reflecting on faith and morality during World War I.

books.title: Recollections of Full Years
books.author: Helen Herron Taft
books.summary: Helen Herron Taft, wife of William Howard Taft, the twenty-seventh President of the United States, recalls her life married to one of America’s most influential political figures.
